html:
Yazz Collective’s Fusion of Nature, Art, and Luxury

Situated in a secluded bay on the picturesque Fethiye coastline, Yazz Collective offers an exclusive boutique retreat along Türkiye’s famed Riviera. This tranquil resort, accessible only by sea, has partnered with Istanbul’s renowned contemporary art gallery, Galeri Bosfor, to present an exhibition that marries art and nature. The exhibition is divided into two parts: a white cube gallery space and a sculpture installation garden. Both spaces invite visitors to explore the vibrant interplay between artistic production and nature, particularly focusing on reactions to the warmth and brightness of the summer season.


boutique resort Yazz Collective proudly hosts an immersive art exhibition from Istanbul-based contemporary art gallery, Galeri Bosfor | all images courtesy of Yazz Collective

a sanctuary for the Senses

Exclusively accessed by boat and completely distant from the city, Yazz Collective has positioned itself as more than just a luxury resort, incorporating contemporary art into its identity and standing out out as a destination where guests can enjoy both relaxation and creative inspiration. The Sanctuary’s commitment to environmental responsibility is woven into every facet of the design, from minimizing its ecological footprint to preserving the landscapes of Göcek-Fethiye. While immersed in the modern green architecture, guests are invited to enjoy refined living, stylish accommodations, a beach restaurant, and spa services. In 2024, Yazz Collective is collaborating with art gallery Galeri Bosfor (see here) for an exhibition that combines cultural engagement with the beauty of the Turkish Riviera, offering visitors an immersion into art as well as an exploration through the resort.


the sustainability approach of Yazz Collective is deeply ingrained in every aspect of operations

Galeri Bosfor’s artistic exhibition curates the turkish RIVIERA

The exhibition unfolds in two distinct spaces: a traditional white-cube gallery and an open-air sculpture garden. These spaces invite guests to explore a rich dialogue between contemporary artistic expression and the natural world, with a particular focus on the radiant warmth of the summer season. A diverse array of artworks is being showcased, each reflecting the unique perspectives of the artists on nature. Paintings, sculptures, and installations capture the essence of the season, from the vibrant hues of sunsets to the serene blues of the sea.


the exhibition is divided into two parts: a white cube gallery space and a sculpture installation garden

This artistic journey invites visitors to contemplate their own interactions with nature, illustrating how our behaviors and experiences shift with the changing seasons. Featured artists include Erman Özbaşaran, Ilgın Seymen, Renin Bilginer, Ahmet Çerkez, Olgu Ülkenciler, Uğur Daştan, Burcu Erden, Murat Atabek, Funda Susamoğlu, Yasha Butler, and Mithat Şen. Their work creates a dynamic bridge between human experience and the natural world, fostering a harmonious dialogue between art, nature, and the observer.


the exhibition features artists Erman Özbaşaran, Ilgın Seymen, Renin Bilginer, Ahmet Çerkez, Olgu Ülkenciler, Uğur Daştan, Burcu Erden, Murat Atabek, Funda Susamoğlu, Yasha Butler and Mithat Şen

Visitors can immerse themselves in the art, while also enjoying the resort’s refined offerings—ranging from a beachfront restaurant to elegant guest houses nestled within the gardens. By day, guests can also relax on the luxurious Bali beds scattered along the private beach, framing the tranquil blue setting. For those seeking further adventure, Yazz Collective offers exclusive private boat tours to explore the 12 surrounding islands. Additionally, back at the resort, traditional Balinese treatments within private spa cabanas await the guests. 

Looking ahead, Yazz Collective will continue to foster artistic engagement throughout the 2025 season, collaborating with both local and international galleries to bring new and exciting exhibitions to the Turkish Riviera. On that note, it should be noted that the 2025 season for Yazz Collective starts in early May.
